classic.title: Amazing Grace
classic.author: John Newton
classic.firstLine: Amazing grace! how sweet the sound
classic.description: One of the most recognizable hymns, written by former slave trader John Newton as a testimony of his conversion.

classic.title: How Great Thou Art
classic.author: Carl Boberg
classic.firstLine: O Lord my God, when I in awesome wonder
classic.description: Swedish hymn translated into English, celebrating God's majesty in creation.

classic.title: Great Is Thy Faithfulness
classic.author: Thomas Chisholm
classic.firstLine: Great is Thy faithfulness, O God my Father
classic.description: Inspired by Lamentations 3:22-23, celebrating God's unchanging faithfulness.

classic.title: It Is Well with My Soul
classic.author: Horatio Spafford
classic.firstLine: When peace like a river attendeth my way
classic.description: Written after tragic loss of Spafford's four daughters at sea, expressing profound faith amid suffering.

classic.title: Holy, Holy, Holy
classic.author: Reginald Heber
classic.firstLine: Holy, holy, holy! Lord God Almighty!
classic.description: Trinity Sunday hymn celebrating the triune nature of God.

classic.title: Be Thou My Vision
classic.author: Ancient Irish
classic.firstLine: Be Thou my vision, O Lord of my heart
classic.description: Ancient Irish hymn expressing desire for God's presence and guidance.

classic.title: Abide with Me
classic.author: Henry Francis Lyte
classic.firstLine: Abide with me; fast falls the eventide
classic.description: Written by Lyte shortly before his death, seeking God's presence in life's twilight.

classic.title: Blessed Assurance
classic.author: Fanny Crosby
classic.firstLine: Blessed assurance, Jesus is mine!
classic.description: Blind hymn writer Fanny Crosby's celebration of salvation and assurance in Christ.

classic.title: Rock of Ages
classic.author: Augustus Toplady
classic.firstLine: Rock of Ages, cleft for me
classic.description: Classic hymn of refuge and salvation in Christ alone.

classic.title: Crown Him with Many Crowns
classic.author: Matthew Bridges
classic.firstLine: Crown Him with many crowns, the Lamb upon His throne
classic.description: Majestic hymn celebrating Christ's kingship and victory.

classic.title: The Old Rugged Cross
classic.author: George Bennard
classic.firstLine: On a hill far away stood an old rugged cross
classic.description: Beloved hymn reflecting on the sacrifice of Christ on the cross.

classic.title: Come, Thou Fount of Every Blessing
classic.author: Robert Robinson
classic.firstLine: Come, Thou Fount of every blessing
classic.description: Hymn expressing gratitude for God's grace and faithfulness.

classic.title: All Hail the Power of Jesus' Name
classic.author: Edward Perronet
classic.firstLine: All hail the power of Jesus' name!
classic.description: Triumphant hymn celebrating the universal reign of Christ.

classic.title: Guide Me, O Thou Great Jehovah
classic.author: William Williams
classic.firstLine: Guide me, O Thou great Jehovah
classic.description: Welsh hymn comparing the Christian journey to Israel's wilderness wandering.

classic.title: Praise God from Whom All Blessings Flow
classic.author: Thomas Ken
classic.firstLine: Praise God, from whom all blessings flow
classic.description: The Doxology, a classic hymn of praise sung in churches worldwide.

classic.title: Love Divine, All Loves Excelling
classic.author: Charles Wesley
classic.firstLine: Love divine, all loves excelling
classic.description: Charles Wesley's beautiful hymn celebrating God's transforming love.

classic.title: Jesus Paid It All
classic.author: Elvina Hall
classic.firstLine: I hear the Savior say, 'Thy strength indeed is small'
classic.description: Hymn celebrating Christ's complete payment for sin.

classic.title: Immortal, Invisible, God Only Wise
classic.author: Walter Chalmers Smith
classic.firstLine: Immortal, invisible, God only wise
classic.description: Hymn praising God's eternal and transcendent nature.

classic.title: Leaning on the Everlasting Arms
classic.author: Elisha Hoffman
classic.firstLine: What a fellowship, what a joy divine
classic.description: Hymn expressing the peace and security found in God's care.

classic.title: Joyful, Joyful, We Adore Thee
classic.author: Henry van Dyke
classic.firstLine: Joyful, joyful, we adore Thee
classic.description: Exuberant hymn of joy set to Beethoven's Ode to Joy melody.

christmas.title: Silent Night
christmas.author: Joseph Mohr
christmas.description: Beloved Austrian carol celebrating the peaceful birth of Christ.

christmas.title: Joy to the World
christmas.author: Isaac Watts
christmas.firstLine: Joy to the world, the Lord is come
christmas.description: Triumphant Christmas hymn based on Psalm 98.

christmas.title: Hark! The Herald Angels Sing
christmas.author: Charles Wesley
christmas.description: Classic Christmas carol announcing Christ's birth.

christmas.title: O Come, All Ye Faithful
christmas.author: John Francis Wade
christmas.firstLine: O come, all ye faithful, joyful and triumphant
christmas.description: Latin origin carol inviting worship of the newborn King.

christmas.title: O Holy Night
christmas.author: Placide Cappeau
christmas.firstLine: O holy night! The stars are brightly shining
christmas.description: French carol celebrating the wonder of Christ's birth.

christmas.title: Away in a Manger
christmas.author: Unknown
christmas.firstLine: Away in a manger, no crib for a bed
christmas.description: Gentle carol depicting the humble circumstances of Jesus' birth.

christmas.title: The First Noel
christmas.author: Traditional
christmas.firstLine: The first Noel the angel did say
christmas.description: Traditional English carol recounting the Christmas story.

christmas.title: Angels We Have Heard on High
christmas.author: Traditional French
christmas.firstLine: Angels we have heard on high
christmas.description: French carol with the famous Gloria refrain.

christmas.title: What Child Is This?
christmas.author: William Dix
christmas.firstLine: What child is this, who, laid to rest
christmas.description: Christmas text set to the tune of Greensleeves.

christmas.title: It Came Upon the Midnight Clear
christmas.author: Edmund Sears
christmas.firstLine: It came upon the midnight clear
christmas.description: American carol emphasizing the angels' message of peace.

easter.title: Christ the Lord Is Risen Today
easter.author: Charles Wesley
easter.firstLine: Christ the Lord is risen today, Alleluia!
easter.description: Triumphant Easter hymn celebrating Christ's resurrection.

easter.title: Up from the Grave He Arose
easter.author: Robert Lowry
easter.firstLine: Low in the grave He lay, Jesus my Savior
easter.description: Victory hymn celebrating Christ's triumph over death.

easter.title: Thine Is the Glory
easter.author: Edmond Budry
easter.firstLine: Thine is the glory, risen, conquering Son
easter.description: Swiss Easter hymn celebrating resurrection victory.

easter.title: Jesus Christ Is Risen Today
easter.author: Latin Carol
easter.firstLine: Jesus Christ is risen today, Alleluia!
easter.description: Ancient Latin carol celebrating Easter joy.

easter.title: Because He Lives
easter.author: Bill Gaither
easter.firstLine: God sent His Son, they called Him Jesus
easter.description: Modern hymn expressing confidence because of Christ's resurrection.

easter.title: He Lives
easter.author: Alfred Ackley
easter.firstLine: I serve a risen Savior, He's in the world today
easter.description: Triumphant affirmation of Christ's living presence.

easter.title: Crown Him with Many Crowns
easter.author: Matthew Bridges
easter.description: Majestic hymn celebrating Christ's resurrection and reign.

easter.title: Christ Arose
easter.author: Robert Lowry
easter.firstLine: Low in the grave He lay
easter.description: Popular Easter hymn with triumphant refrain.

easter.title: Alleluia! Alleluia! Hearts to Heaven
easter.author: Christopher Wordsworth
easter.firstLine: Alleluia! Alleluia! Hearts to heaven and voices raise
easter.description: Joyful Easter hymn of praise and celebration.

easter.title: Welcome Happy Morning
easter.author: Venantius Fortunatus
easter.firstLine: Welcome, happy morning! Age to age shall say
easter.description: Ancient Easter hymn from the 6th century.

marian.title: Ave Maria
marian.author: Traditional
marian.description: The most famous prayer to Mary, set to music by many composers.

marian.title: Hail, Holy Queen Enthroned Above
marian.author: Traditional
marian.description: Hymn honoring Mary as Queen of Heaven.

marian.title: Immaculate Mary
marian.author: Jeremiah Cummings
marian.firstLine: Immaculate Mary, your praises we sing

marian.title: Salve Regina
marian.author: Hermann of Reichenau
marian.description: Ancient Marian antiphon, one of the four Marian anthems.

marian.title: O Sanctissima
marian.author: Traditional
marian.description: Traditional hymn honoring Mary and Jesus.

marian.title: Hail, Queen of Heaven
marian.author: Traditional
marian.firstLine: Hail, Queen of heaven, the ocean star
marian.description: English version of Ave Maris Stella.

marian.title: Daily, Daily Sing to Mary
marian.author: Bernard of Cluny
marian.description: Hymn encouraging daily devotion to Mary.

marian.title: Sing of Mary
marian.author: Unknown
marian.firstLine: Sing of Mary, pure and lowly
marian.description: Modern Marian hymn celebrating Mary's role.

marian.title: My Soul Proclaims (Magnificat)
marian.author: Mary, Mother of Jesus
marian.firstLine: My soul proclaims the greatness of the Lord

marian.title: The Virgin Mary Had a Baby Boy
marian.author: Traditional Caribbean
marian.firstLine: The Virgin Mary had a baby boy

liturgical.title: Holy God, We Praise Thy Name
liturgical.author: Ignaz Franz
liturgical.firstLine: Holy God, we praise Thy Name
liturgical.description: Te Deum in vernacular, majestic hymn of praise.

liturgical.title: Pange Lingua Gloriosi
liturgical.author: Thomas Aquinas
liturgical.description: Eucharistic hymn by St. Thomas Aquinas for Corpus Christi.

liturgical.title: Tantum Ergo
liturgical.author: Thomas Aquinas
liturgical.description: Last two verses of Pange Lingua, used for Benediction.

liturgical.title: O Salutaris Hostia
liturgical.author: Thomas Aquinas
liturgical.description: Eucharistic hymn commonly used during exposition.

liturgical.title: Veni Creator Spiritus
liturgical.author: Hrabanus Maurus
liturgical.description: Ancient hymn invoking the Holy Spirit.

liturgical.title: Stabat Mater
liturgical.author: Jacopone da Todi
liturgical.description: Medieval hymn depicting Mary at the cross.

liturgical.title: Veni Sancte Spiritus
liturgical.author: Stephen Langton
liturgical.description: Pentecost sequence, Golden Sequence of the Church.

liturgical.title: Dies Irae
liturgical.author: Thomas of Celano
liturgical.description: Medieval Latin hymn for the dead, Day of Wrath.

latin.title: Ave Verum Corpus
latin.author: Unknown
latin.description: Eucharistic hymn, set to music by Mozart and others.

latin.title: Alma Redemptoris Mater
latin.author: Hermann of Reichenau
latin.description: Marian antiphon for Advent and Christmas.

latin.title: Ave Maris Stella
latin.author: Venantius Fortunatus
latin.firstLine: Ave maris stella, Dei Mater alma
latin.description: Ancient Marian hymn, Star of the Sea.

latin.title: Te Deum Laudamus
latin.author: Nicetas of Remesiana
latin.description: Ancient hymn of praise, We Praise Thee, O God.

latin.title: Kyrie Eleison
latin.author: Traditional
latin.description: Ancient liturgical prayer, Lord have mercy.

latin.title: Gloria Patri
latin.author: Traditional
latin.firstLine: Gloria Patri, et Filio, et Spiritui Sancto
latin.description: Doxology, Glory be to the Father.

latin.title: Agnus Dei
latin.author: Traditional
latin.firstLine: Agnus Dei, qui tollis peccata mundi

latin.title: Sanctus
latin.author: Traditional
latin.firstLine: Sanctus, Sanctus, Sanctus Dominus Deus Sabaoth

latin.title: Jesu Dulcis Memoria
latin.author: Bernard of Clairvaux
latin.description: Medieval hymn on the sweetness of Jesus.

reformation.title: A Mighty Fortress Is Our God
reformation.author: Martin Luther
reformation.firstLine: A mighty fortress is our God
reformation.description: Luther's powerful Reformation hymn based on Psalm 46.

reformation.title: Now Thank We All Our God
reformation.author: Martin Rinkart
reformation.firstLine: Now thank we all our God

reformation.title: Praise, My Soul, the King of Heaven
reformation.author: Henry Francis Lyte
reformation.firstLine: Praise, my soul, the King of heaven

reformation.title: All Creatures of Our God and King
reformation.author: Francis of Assisi
reformation.firstLine: All creatures of our God and King

reformation.title: Christ Is Made the Sure Foundation
reformation.author: Latin, 7th century
reformation.firstLine: Christ is made the sure foundation
reformation.description: Ancient Latin hymn on Christ as cornerstone.

reformation.title: O Sacred Head, Now Wounded
reformation.author: Bernard of Clairvaux
reformation.description: Medieval passion hymn translated by Paul Gerhardt.

reformation.title: Come, Holy Spirit, God and Lord
reformation.author: Martin Luther
reformation.firstLine: Come, Holy Spirit, God and Lord

reformation.title: From Heaven Above to Earth I Come
reformation.author: Martin Luther
reformation.firstLine: From heaven above to earth I come
reformation.description: Luther's Christmas hymn for his son.

reformation.title: Lord, Keep Us Steadfast in Your Word
reformation.author: Martin Luther
reformation.firstLine: Lord, keep us steadfast in Your Word

reformation.title: Savior of the Nations, Come
reformation.author: Ambrose of Milan
reformation.description: Ancient Advent hymn translated by Luther.

gospel.title: Just as I Am
gospel.author: Charlotte Elliott
gospel.firstLine: Just as I am, without one plea
gospel.description: Classic invitation hymn used in evangelistic crusades.

gospel.title: What a Friend We Have in Jesus
gospel.author: Joseph Scriven
gospel.firstLine: What a friend we have in Jesus
gospel.description: Comfort hymn emphasizing prayer and friendship with Christ.

gospel.title: Victory in Jesus
gospel.author: Eugene Bartlett
gospel.firstLine: I heard an old, old story

gospel.title: Softly and Tenderly
gospel.author: Will Thompson
gospel.firstLine: Softly and tenderly Jesus is calling
gospel.description: Gentle invitation hymn, favorite of D.L. Moody.

gospel.title: At the Cross
gospel.author: Isaac Watts/Ralph Hudson
gospel.firstLine: Alas! and did my Savior bleed
gospel.description: Gospel refrain added to Watts' hymn.

gospel.title: Revive Us Again
gospel.author: William MacKay
gospel.firstLine: We praise Thee, O God, for the Son of Thy love

gospel.title: Sweet Hour of Prayer
gospel.author: William Walford
gospel.firstLine: Sweet hour of prayer! sweet hour of prayer!
gospel.description: Classic hymn on the blessing of prayer.

gospel.title: I Love to Tell the Story
gospel.author: Katherine Hankey
gospel.firstLine: I love to tell the story of unseen things above
gospel.description: Evangelistic hymn expressing joy in sharing the Gospel.

gospel.title: Blessed Be the Name
gospel.author: William Clark
gospel.firstLine: O for a thousand tongues to sing
gospel.description: Gospel hymn of praise and testimony.

gospel.title: When We All Get to Heaven
gospel.author: Eliza Hewitt
gospel.firstLine: Sing the wondrous love of Jesus

contemporary.title: In Christ Alone
contemporary.author: Keith Getty/Stuart Townend
contemporary.firstLine: In Christ alone my hope is found
contemporary.description: Modern hymn celebrating Christ's life, death, and resurrection.

contemporary.title: There Is Power in the Blood
contemporary.author: Lewis Jones
contemporary.firstLine: Would you be free from the burden of sin?
contemporary.description: Powerful hymn on Christ's atoning blood.

contemporary.title: 10,000 Reasons (Bless the Lord)
contemporary.author: Matt Redman/Jonas Myrin
contemporary.firstLine: Bless the Lord, O my soul
contemporary.description: Contemporary worship song based on Psalm 103.

contemporary.title: How Deep the Father's Love for Us
contemporary.author: Stuart Townend
contemporary.firstLine: How deep the Father's love for us
contemporary.description: Modern hymn reflecting on the cross.

contemporary.title: Cornerstone
contemporary.author: Hillsong Worship
contemporary.firstLine: My hope is built on nothing less

contemporary.title: Good Good Father
contemporary.author: Pat Barrett/Tony Brown
contemporary.description: Contemporary song celebrating God's fatherly love.

contemporary.title: Oceans (Where Feet May Fail)
contemporary.author: Hillsong United
contemporary.firstLine: You call me out upon the waters
contemporary.description: Contemporary worship song about trust and faith.

contemporary.title: Here I Am to Worship
contemporary.author: Tim Hughes
contemporary.firstLine: Light of the world, You stepped down into darkness

contemporary.title: Great Are You Lord
contemporary.author: All Sons & Daughters
contemporary.firstLine: You give life, You are love

byzantine.title: O Theotokos and Virgin, Rejoice
byzantine.author: Archangel Gabriel
byzantine.description: Angelic salutation to Mary in Orthodox tradition.

byzantine.title: Christ Is Risen from the Dead
byzantine.author: St. John of Damascus
byzantine.firstLine: Christ is risen from the dead
byzantine.description: Primary Paschal troparion of Orthodox Easter.

byzantine.title: Holy God (Trisagion)
byzantine.author: Ancient
byzantine.firstLine: Holy God, Holy Mighty, Holy Immortal
byzantine.description: Ancient thrice-holy hymn of the Orthodox Church.

byzantine.title: The Virgin Today
byzantine.author: St. Romanos the Melodist
byzantine.firstLine: The Virgin today gives birth to the Transcendent One

byzantine.title: Cherubic Hymn
byzantine.author: Byzantine
byzantine.firstLine: Let us who mystically represent the Cherubim
byzantine.description: Divine Liturgy hymn during the Great Entrance.

byzantine.title: Axion Estin
byzantine.author: Traditional
byzantine.firstLine: It is truly meet to bless you, O Theotokos
byzantine.description: Principal hymn to the Theotokos in Divine Liturgy.

byzantine.title: The Angel Cried
byzantine.author: St. John of Damascus
byzantine.firstLine: The angel cried to the Lady full of grace

byzantine.title: O Gladsome Light
byzantine.author: Ancient
byzantine.firstLine: O gladsome light of the holy glory

byzantine.title: Only Begotten Son
byzantine.author: Emperor Justinian
byzantine.firstLine: Only begotten Son and immortal Word of God
byzantine.description: Hymn before the Gospel in Divine Liturgy.

byzantine.title: Come Let Us Worship
byzantine.author: Traditional
byzantine.firstLine: Come, let us worship and bow down before Christ

troparion.title: Troparion of the Resurrection (Tone 1)
troparion.author: Traditional
troparion.firstLine: Though the stone was sealed by the Jews

troparion.title: Troparion of the Transfiguration
troparion.author: Traditional
troparion.firstLine: You were transfigured on the mountain, O Christ God

troparion.title: Troparion of the Nativity
troparion.author: St. Cosmas
troparion.firstLine: Your nativity, O Christ our God

troparion.title: Troparion of Theophany
troparion.author: Traditional
troparion.firstLine: When You, O Lord, were baptized in the Jordan

troparion.title: Troparion of the Dormition
troparion.author: St. John of Damascus
troparion.firstLine: In birth you preserved your virginity
troparion.description: Feast of Dormition of the Theotokos.

troparion.title: Troparion of the Cross
troparion.author: Traditional
troparion.firstLine: O Lord, save Your people and bless Your inheritance
troparion.description: Exaltation of the Holy Cross troparion.

troparion.title: Troparion of Pentecost
troparion.author: Traditional
troparion.firstLine: Blessed are You, O Christ our God
troparion.description: Pentecost troparion celebrating the Holy Spirit.

troparion.title: Troparion of the Ascension
troparion.author: Traditional
troparion.firstLine: You have ascended in glory, O Christ our God

troparion.title: Troparion of the Annunciation
troparion.author: Traditional
troparion.firstLine: Today is the beginning of our salvation

troparion.title: Troparion of the Presentation
troparion.author: Traditional
troparion.firstLine: Rejoice, O Virgin Theotokos, full of grace
troparion.description: Presentation of Christ in the Temple.

worship.title: Shout to the Lord
worship.author: Darlene Zschech
worship.firstLine: My Jesus, my Savior, Lord, there is none like You

worship.title: As the Deer
worship.author: Martin Nystrom
worship.firstLine: As the deer panteth for the water

worship.title: Open the Eyes of My Heart
worship.author: Paul Baloche
worship.firstLine: Open the eyes of my heart, Lord

worship.title: Way Maker
worship.author: Sinach
worship.firstLine: You are here, moving in our midst

worship.title: Reckless Love
worship.author: Cory Asbury
worship.firstLine: Before I spoke a word, You were singing over me
worship.description: Modern worship anthem on God's pursuing love.

worship.title: What a Beautiful Name
worship.author: Hillsong Worship
worship.firstLine: You were the Word at the beginning
worship.description: Award-winning worship song celebrating Jesus' name.

worship.title: Whom Shall I Fear (God of Angel Armies)

worship.firstLine: You hear me when I call
worship.description: Contemporary worship song about God's protection.

worship.title: Build My Life

worship.title: Lion and the Lamb
worship.author: Bethel Music
worship.firstLine: He's coming on the clouds, kings and kingdoms will bow down
